Name: Proper disposal of deceased animals.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to proper disposal of deceased animals

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to provide information regarding city services available for the proper disposal of deceased animals, and to post such information online.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 8 of title 17 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 17-817 to read as follows:
      � 17-817 Disposal of deceased animals. The department shall provide information regarding city services that are available for proper disposal of deceased animals and shall post such information to its website.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 90 days after it becomes law.
